perturbation.original_text: AJR shall use its best efforts to promote the name, image, brand and reputation of XC and the products and services of XC. In addition, AJR shall assist XC in evaluating various applications of wearable and wireless devices to automobile racing including
perturbation.changed_text: AJR shall endeavor to promote the name, image, brand and reputation of XC and the products and services of XC. In addition, AJR may assist XC in evaluating various applications of wearable and wireless devices to automobile racing including
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'shall use its best efforts' to 'shall endeavor' weakens the obligation. 'Endeavor' is less stringent than 'best efforts,' making it difficult to enforce a specific level of promotion. Also, changing 'shall assist' to 'may assist' makes the assistance optional instead of required. This introduces ambiguity.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Breach of Contract - Creates an ambiguous obligation that undermines the original intent of a clear, enforceable promotional commitment; therefore rendering it unenforceable. While not a direct violation of a specific law, it undermines the enforceability of a contract clause, which has broad legal ramifications.

perturbation.original_text: AJR shall provide XC with such information regarding AJR as XC shall request for inclusion in the registration statement and shall indemnify the Company and hold it harmless with respect to any material misstatement or material omission with respect to such information
perturbation.changed_text: AJR will, when practical, provide XC with information regarding AJR as XC deems necessary for inclusion in the registration statement, and will attempt to indemnify the Company with respect to significant misstatements or major omissions.
perturbation.explanation: This revision introduces vagueness in several ways. Changing 'shall provide' to 'will, when practical' makes the provision of information conditional. Replacing 'as XC shall request' with 'as XC deems necessary' shifts the control over the information provided. Replacing shall indemnify to will attempt to indemnify weakens the legal obligation.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Securities Act of 1933 - Specifically, Section 11 regarding liability for false registration statements. By weakening the indemnification clause to 'will attempt to indemnify,' the modified text undermines the protections afforded to investors against material misstatements or omissions in registration statements, potentially conflicting with the requirements for accurate and complete disclosure.

perturbation.original_text: AJR shall not take any action or suffer any action to occur, whether taken by the Team or others, which could result in an adverse impact on XC, its Licensed Materials and the goodwill associated therewith as a result of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: AJR will attempt to avoid actions that may conceivably lead to a potential negative effect on XC or its licensed materials.
perturbation.explanation: The original text had a clear obligation to prevent any adverse impact. The changed text weakens this by using 'will attempt to avoid' (weakens the obligation), 'may conceivably lead' (introduces uncertainty) and 'potential negative effect' (is vague compared to adverse impact).
perturbation.contradicted_law: Breach of Contract/Duty of Good Faith - It weakens the duty of good faith and fair dealing implied in every contract, as it makes the obligation to protect the other party's goodwill less certain and enforceable.
